ALEXANDER CITY DIVISION
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
)

v. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
)
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
)
DEFENDANT )
MOTION TO ALLOW EXTENDED DISCOVERY
Comes now the Plaintiff/Father, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney of record, Dianne James Davis, and moves this Honorable Court to allow extended
discovery in this matter in excess of the number permitted under the Alabama Rules of Civil
Procedure. As grounds for said motion, Plaintiff/Father would show the Court the following:
1) That this matter involves issues related to visitation and contempt of prior court
orders, which necessitate detailed inquiries into parenting capacity, the
appropriateness and stability of custodial arrangements, and the overall
circumstances affecting visitation, as well as to gather evidence relevant to the
best interests, safety, and welfare of the minor children of the parties.
2) That additional discovery is necessary to obtain complete information regarding
the following:
a) Facts relevant to custody and parenting arrangements, including
each parent’s availability, caretaking responsibilities, and ability to
meet the children’s needs;
b) Facts relevant to visitation, including each party’s availability, and
consistency in exercising visitation; and
c) Other matters that directly impact the best interests, welfare, and
stability of the minor children.
3) That pursuant to Rule 33 of the Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure “A party shall
not propound more than forty (40) interrogatories to any other party without
leave of court. Upon motion and for good cause shown, the court may increase
the number of interrogatories that a party may serve upon another party.”
DOCUMENT 275
4) That without leave of the Court to serve discovery requests in excess of the numerical
limitations, the Father cannot adequately obtain the information required to address the
custody and support matters at issue in this matter.
Wherefore, the above premises considered, the Plaintiff/Father respectfully requests
that the Court enter an Order permitting him to serve extended discovery requests exceeding the
numerical limitations of the Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure.
Respectfully submitted on this the 16th day of September, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
